definitions: sympathetic sorrow for someone's misfortune or suffering
something regrettable or unfortunate that causes disappointment
examples: She felt deep pity for the homeless children
His eyes showed genuine pity for her loss
What a pity that the concert was cancelled
It's such a pity to waste good food

definitions: central point on which something turns or rotates
fixed pin or shaft supporting something that turns
fundamental change in strategy or direction of action
examples: The door swings on its pivot smoothly
The pivot allows the arm to rotate freely
The basketball player executed a perfect pivot move
She placed her foot as pivot before turning
The company made a strategic pivot to online sales
This decision marked a pivot in their approach

definitions: informal term for photographs or pictures, especially digital ones
examples: Send me the pix from yesterday's party
She posted vacation pix on social media

definitions: smallest controllable element of a picture on a screen display
examples: The image resolution is 1920 by 1080 pixels
Dead pixels appeared as black dots on the monitor

definitions: small supernatural being in folklore with pointed ears and magical powers
very short hairstyle for women with close-cropped sides and back
examples: Children love stories about pixies and fairies
The garden statue depicted a mischievous pixie
She got a pixie cut for the summer
The pixie style suits her face perfectly

definitions: flat round bread topped with tomato sauce, cheese, and various toppings
examples: They ordered pepperoni pizza for dinner
The wood-fired pizza had a crispy crust

definitions: restaurant that specializes in making and serving pizzas
examples: The new pizzeria downtown makes authentic Neapolitan pizza
They met at their favorite pizzeria every Friday

definitions: large notice or sign for public display, often used in protests
official notice posted in a public place as announcement
examples: Protesters carried placards demanding justice
The placard displayed the new parking regulations
Safety placards were posted throughout the construction site
The placard on the door listed office hours

definitions: particular position, point, or area in space
position in a sequence, competition, or hierarchy
person's home or residence
proper or designated position or role in society
examples: This is the perfect place for a picnic
Mark the place where you found the artifact
She finished in third place in the marathon
Save my place in line while I'm gone
Come over to my place after work
Their place has a beautiful garden
Everyone has their place in the community
Know your place in the organization

definitions: substance with no therapeutic effect used as control in testing new drugs
examples: Half the patients received placebos during the trial
The placebo effect can produce real improvements

definitions: symbol or piece of text used temporarily in place of final content
examples: Lorem ipsum text serves as a placeholder
The image placeholder showed where photos would go

definitions: player who kicks field goals and extra points in American football
examples: The placekicker scored the winning field goal
Their placekicker has perfect accuracy this season

definitions: action or process of placing something in position
finding of employment or housing for someone
assignment to a particular class or course level
examples: Careful placement of furniture maximized the space
The placement of the sculpture was perfect
The agency handles job placement for graduates
She found placement through the employment center
His placement in advanced math was well-deserved
Student placement tests occur before registration

definitions: temporary organ that nourishes fetus during pregnancy through the umbilical cord
examples: The placenta provides oxygen and nutrients to the developing baby
After birth, the placenta is naturally expelled

definitions: mammal whose young develop inside the uterus with nourishment from placenta
examples: Humans are placental mammals unlike marsupials
Most placental mammals have longer gestation periods

definitions: deposit of sand or gravel containing valuable minerals
person who places or positions things in specific locations
examples: Gold miners worked the placer deposits along the river
Placer mining requires less equipment than hard rock mining
The tile placer ensured each piece was perfectly aligned
As head placer, she arranged all the table settings

definitions: practice of taking someone else's work or ideas and passing them as one's own
examples: The student was expelled for plagiarism
Software can detect plagiarism in academic papers

definitions: contagious bacterial disease with high mortality rate
thing causing trouble or irritation over a wide area
examples: The bubonic plague devastated medieval Europe
Plague outbreaks still occur in some regions
A plague of locusts destroyed the crops
Technical problems plague the new software

definitions: pattern of crossed horizontal and vertical bands in multiple colors
cloth or garment with a plaid pattern
examples: The Scottish kilt featured traditional plaid
She wore a red and black plaid shirt
He wrapped himself in warm plaid during winter
The plaid matched the family tartan perfectly

definitions: large area of flat land with few trees
lacking decoration or ornamentation in appearance
examples: Buffalo once roamed the Great Plains
The vast plain stretched to the horizon
She preferred plain clothes without patterns
The room had plain white walls

definitions: person who brings a case against another in court of law
examples: The plaintiff seeks damages for breach of contract
Both plaintiff and defendant appeared before the judge

definitions: detailed proposal for doing or achieving something
scale drawing showing arrangement of building or structure
examples: Their business plan impressed the investors
We need a backup plan in case of rain
The architect submitted revised building plans
Floor plans show the layout of each room

definitions: powered flying vehicle with fixed wings
flat or level surface
tool for smoothing or shaping wood
flat surface in geometry extending infinitely
examples: The plane landed safely despite bad weather
She took a plane to visit her family
The carpenter ensured the table was perfectly plane
Water finds its own plane when undisturbed
He used a plane to smooth the door edge
The hand plane removed thin wood shavings
Two points determine a line, three determine a plane
The plane intersects the sphere at a circle

definitions: power tool that smooths and thicknesses boards
person who operates a planing machine or uses hand planes
examples: The planer produced boards of uniform thickness
Feed the wood slowly through the planer
The skilled planer prepared all surfaces perfectly
As head planer, he trained new woodworkers

definitions: celestial body moving in orbit around a star
examples: Earth is the third planet from the Sun
Scientists discovered a new planet outside our solar system

definitions: building with domed ceiling for projecting images of celestial objects
examples: The planetarium offers shows about constellations
School children visited the planetarium for astronomy lessons

definitions: long flat piece of timber used in building
fundamental point of political or organizational platform
exercise position supporting body horizontally on forearms and toes
examples: Carpenters nailed planks to create the deck
The old plank creaked under his weight
Environmental protection was a key plank in their platform
This plank addresses healthcare reform
Hold the plank position for thirty seconds
Planks strengthen your core muscles

definitions: boards collectively used as flooring or ship's deck covering
activity of lying face down in unusual locations for photographs
examples: The ship's planking needed repair after the storm
Oak planking covered the entire floor
Planking photos went viral on social media
He tried planking on top of the monument

definitions: small organisms drifting in water that serve as food for larger animals
examples: Whales feed on plankton filtered from seawater
Plankton forms the base of the ocean food chain

definitions: person whose job involves making plans for development or events
book or software for scheduling and organizing activities
examples: The urban planner designed the new residential district
Wedding planners coordinate all event details
She writes appointments in her daily planner
Digital planners sync across all devices

definitions: process of making plans for something
control of urban development through zoning and permits
examples: Careful planning ensures project success
Planning the conference took several months
The planning commission approved the new development
Urban planning shapes how cities grow

definitions: living organism that grows in earth and has stem, leaves, and roots
factory or industrial facility for manufacturing or processing
person placed secretly to observe or influence others
examples: Water the plant every three days
Native plants thrive in local conditions
The auto plant employs thousands of workers
They built a new processing plant downtown
The journalist was a plant in the organization
Police plants infiltrated the criminal gang

definitions: starchy banana variety typically cooked before eating
common weed with broad leaves found in lawns and paths
examples: Fried plantains are popular in Caribbean cuisine
Green plantains taste best when cooked
Plantain weeds spread quickly through the lawn
The herbalist used plantain leaves for medicine

definitions: large estate where crops are grown, historically with enslaved labor
area planted with trees or shrubs for commercial purposes
examples: Cotton plantations dominated the antebellum South
The coffee plantation covered hundreds of acres
The pine plantation provides timber for construction
Rubber plantations require specific climate conditions

definitions: decorative container in which plants are grown
person who owns or manages a plantation
machine for planting seeds in rows
examples: The ceramic planter held beautiful orchids
Window planters brightened the apartment
Colonial planters controlled vast estates
The tobacco planter owned hundreds of acres
The corn planter spaces seeds precisely
Modern planters can plant multiple rows simultaneously

definitions: action of putting seeds or plants in ground to grow
area where plants have been placed or established
examples: Spring planting begins after the last frost
Proper planting depth ensures good germination
The new planting along the border looks beautiful
Native plantings attract local wildlife

definitions: flat piece of metal, wood, or stone with inscription
sticky film of bacteria that forms on teeth
fatty deposit on inner walls of arteries
examples: A brass plaque marked the historic building
The memorial plaque honored fallen soldiers
Regular brushing removes plaque from teeth
Plaque buildup causes tooth decay
Arterial plaque increases heart disease risk
Cholesterol forms plaque in blood vessels

definitions: yellowish liquid component of blood without cells
highly ionized gas with equal positive and negative particles
flat display technology using ionized gas cells
examples: Plasma carries nutrients throughout the body
Blood plasma can be donated separately from blood
Stars consist primarily of plasma
Plasma forms at extremely high temperatures
The plasma TV provided excellent picture quality
Plasma displays were popular before LED technology

definitions: paste that hardens to smooth solid used for coating walls
adhesive bandage or cast material for medical use
examples: Fresh plaster covered the repaired wall
The plaster ceiling showed ornate details
The nurse applied a plaster to the wound
His broken arm was set in plaster

definitions: skilled worker who applies plaster to walls and ceilings
examples: The plasterer created decorative ceiling moldings
Experienced plasterers can achieve perfectly smooth finishes

definitions: process or skill of applying plaster to surfaces
examples: Plastering requires steady hands and patience
The plastering work transformed rough walls

definitions: ornamental or molded plaster used as architectural decoration
examples: Victorian homes featured elaborate plasterwork
The plasterwork on the ceiling needed restoration

definitions: synthetic material made from polymers that can be molded
credit cards or debit cards collectively
examples: Plastic bottles can be recycled
The toy was made of durable plastic
She prefers paying with plastic instead of cash
Most stores accept plastic as payment

definitions: quality of being easily shaped or molded without breaking or returning to original form
examples: Brain plasticity allows learning throughout life
The plasticity of clay makes it ideal for sculpture

definitions: measured piece of land or plot shown on a map
examples: The surveyor marked the plat boundaries
Each plat in the subdivision was one acre

definitions: flat dish from which food is eaten or served
thin flat sheet of metal or other material
rigid segment of Earth's lithosphere that moves
removable dental appliance with artificial teeth
examples: Please set plates on the dining table
The waiter brought our plates of pasta
Steel plates reinforced the ship's hull
The license plate identified the vehicle
Tectonic plates shift causing earthquakes
The Pacific plate is the largest oceanic plate
Her dental plate replaced missing upper teeth
The orthodontic plate corrected his bite

definitions: area of high flat land raised sharply above surrounding area
period of stability with little or no change after growth
examples: The Tibetan plateau is called the roof of the world
Ancient civilizations thrived on the plateau
Weight loss often hits a plateau after initial success
Sales reached a plateau and remained steady

definitions: small colorless disk-shaped cell fragment vital for blood clotting
examples: Low platelet count can cause excessive bleeding
Platelets aggregate to form blood clots

definitions: person who coats objects with thin layer of metal
examples: The gold plater restored antique jewelry
Chrome platers work with hazardous chemicals

definitions: raised level surface for people or equipment to stand on
operating system or software framework for applications
declared policies and principles of political party
digital service enabling user interaction and content sharing
examples: Passengers waited on the train platform
The speaker stood on a raised platform
The app runs on multiple platforms
They developed software for the Windows platform
The candidate outlined her political platform
Environmental protection was central to their platform
The social media platform gained millions of users
Content creators use the platform to reach audiences
